summary:
I am a highly motivated person and professional, eager to learn and always open for a better idea. 
I enjoy simplifying processes, and I believe that success comes with the support of others. 
Passionate about continuous improvement, digital manufacturing, operations transformation, connected factory, paperless & sustainability.

[{'company': {'id': 2238, 'name': 'Danone', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQHRVO1SZWT1aA/company-logo_400_400/0/1663934939088?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=HWhJORqRvSFuJI7TtbdYcWuN5SXz63f5bHoKMwOmf9A', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/danone/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Danone', 'description': 'About: As part of the Global Operations Transformation team, the Digital
Manufacturing Acceleration team is responsible for the implementation of Industry 4.0 in Danone. The Digital Manufacturing Acceleration program is a productivity driven program with the goal of deliverying 8-12% reduction of factory controllable cost. 

Main responsibilities:
• Global owner and team leader for the Digital Use Case Catalogue in Danone, with +15 standard tools with more than 100 use cases for scalable & affordable rollouts  supported by central teams.
• Supporting globally the adoption of Digital Use Cases and User adoption, with end goal of creating productivity without capex.
• Responsible for the design and future digitalization of IWS (Integrated Work Systems)', 'title': 'Global Digital Manufacturing Senior Manager', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Danone', 'description': 'I am currently part of the team in charge of the design and implementation of Industry 4.0 at SN division in Danone. With special focus in Connected Factory.

Main responsibilities: 
• Lead for Connected Factory pillar in SN, where I help to develop the strategy and support implementation across our 25 factories worldwide.
• Oversee and support the digital manufacturing roadmap implementation for lighthouse factories in SN.
• In charge of the Paperless Certification to improve nature, performance and accelerate the digital manufacturing implementation.', 'title': 'SN Global Digital Manufacturing Manager', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Amsterdam Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'Danone', 'description': 'As part of the Regional Operations Projects Department in Danone, I am responsible to execute ‘end to end’ new products introductions, secure & renovation projects with impact across our European manufacturing sites.

Main responsibilities: 
•	Since April 2018, I have been the Operations leader for a key regional project to manage the changes needed to be compliant to a new Infant Food regulation in EU, with an impact of around 2bn in Sales. 
•	Currently responsible for 3 key projects directly linked to the regulatory deadline in February 2020.
•	Build up a solid and sound project organization and animation model across six factories in Europe, 30 business units worldwide& central teams located in Amsterdam and Utrecht. More than 100 dedicated FTEs and >1K involved.
•	Define and report of key milestones & KPIs to top management during a monthly steering committee.', 'title': 'Operations Project Senior Manager', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Amsterdam Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Danone', 'description': None, 'title': 'Operations Project Manager', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 2251996, 'name': 'Caliber Game changers in store development', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQED6zhV19BfEQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1636716266549?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=tU5kp4lej8sSagxw4K6EHreIxmgK9wmVNZ8-ZAb_y3E', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/caliberglobal/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Arnhem, Provincie Gelderland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'Caliber.global', 'description': 'Caliber, game changers in store development is all about raising the bar with people, technology and services that are fueled by ambition, focus and energy." 

Caliber’s mission is to make the global supply chain for store development easier, faster and more efficient.

Main Responsibilities: 
- Manage Store Development Projects in the EMEAS
- Last Mile projects
- Develop and introduce Continuous Improvement Culture in the Company
- Introduce our associates to Lean Thinking and Six Sigma concepts
- Develop an in-house LSS certification
- Manage Lean Projects', 'title': 'Project Manager', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1586478, 'name': 'Ardagh Group', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQFXl3EcHoPYeQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1519883531261?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=PcpzrEnp16jEd2M13AyI9tdOEJTiPiiI4zaoAuwoMZM', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/ardagh-group/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'company': 'Ardagh Group', 'description': 'The international management trainees spend 24 months working in various departments and business functions across numerous different countries for the glass business. With this programme the trainees gain international experience and develop a broad range of skills while working for a global company.

Projects: 
- Reduction of the blockage size per defect found in Furnace 15 / Dongen , NL/ Accomplishments: Expected savings of €122.636/ year in Cost per Quality.
- Development of a data base for the Inspection equipment "CANDELA" / Dongen, NL / Goal: Automatic reporting for dimensional specifications of containers. 
- Ideal Test Sample for Dip&Saddle / Dongen, NL/ Goal: Elimination of customer complains & blockage by a better understanding of the settings of our inspection equipment. 
- Develop a Moulds life-time report / Group project / Goal: Develop a management-tool report for lifetime of moulds, better assessment of trials.', 'title': 'International Management Trainee', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 2059, 'name': 'TE Connectivity', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQG-i3JeAnUa_Q/company-logo_400_400/0/1667828715453?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=verJrroqQlZ3JmifyT2ZUzc1l9Ys8EX0p_esfvaVlLI', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/te-connectivity/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Hermosillo Area, Mexico', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'company': 'TE Connectivity', 'description': '- Responsible for the managing the supply chain from supplier to end customer to provide the best possible planning for >12 production lines, more than 1000 products.
- Assured the availability of necessary materials for production based on internal/external forecast and by a persistent communication with buyers and creation of PO’s.
- Daily communication with customer service/direct customer in the EMEIA and America regions. Analyse and presentation of customer satisfaction data trough reports, graphics and charts.

> Key accomplishments: Provided an effective planning since week 1. Reduced late orders to clients by 50% within two months and 90% by the time of departure; recover portfolio of >100K USD. Crated an effective line of communication with customer service in order to reduce complains; reduction of 60% of customer service complains by email. Development of charts to easily understand main reasons for late orders and creation of action plans.', 'title': 'Materials Planner', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1592, 'name': 'T-Systems', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQFoewbIhwqUIw/company-logo_400_400/0/1688367627027?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=oSWMuLnvhQnl0N70ciINcvA1MoVms7TPE02B5jCQV6E', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/t-systems/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Puebla de Zaragoza Area, Mexico', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'company': 'T-Systems International', 'description': '- Design of the campaign Innova-T, campaign with the objective of recollect the best innovative ideas among the employees and utilize the know-how of the internal talent to improve the IT and management processes.
- Research about how to apply principles from lean manufacturing (lean thinking, process innovations) in the IT services industry.

> Key accomplishments: Elaboration of business case for one of the winner ideas of the Innova-T and presentation to the top management. Support for the development of an online tool used for the Innova-T. Development of a PPT presentation of innovative ideas for applying lean manufacturing/six-sigma concepts in the IT industry.', 'title': 'Summer Internship', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1015, 'name': 'GE', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQHNSdSY_UJ_rg/company-logo_400_400/0/1688184041330?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=2FZEkjWYfNtBApPDsLUarZQrScyJZdAn_QxlTJYVwEY', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/ge/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Nogales, Mexico', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'company': 'GE', 'description': '-Winner of the General Electric contest: Lean Challenge 2012.
-The GE Lean Challenge competition involves teams of engineering and technology students from universities across different nations working collaboratively to solve real world technology, engineering, and manufacturing problems by the application of Lean manufacturing and six sigma concepts in projects of high impact.

> Key accomplishments: Team leader of the winner team of 2012 in the plant of Nogales. Implemented automation in the curing process for high voltage transformers that lead to a 95% of takt time attainment for the process and double productivity of the process. Improved 80% of the CTQ’s (critical to quality) to L1 (poka-yoke) in one type of winder machine. Eliminated 3 ergonomic& safe concerns and estimated annual savings of 35 K US in ergonomic and safety concerns avoidance.', 'title': 'Lean challenge', 'employment_type': None}]}]
